suite2p.utils¶

Module Contents¶

suite2p.utils.boundary(ypix, xpix)[source]¶

returns pixels of mask that are on the exterior of the mask

suite2p.utils.circle(med, r)[source]¶

returns pixels of circle with radius 1.25x radius of cell (r)

suite2p.utils.fitMVGaus(y, x, lam, thres=2.5)[source]¶

computes 2D gaussian fit to data and returns ellipse of radius thres standard deviations.

Parameters

  • y (float, array) – pixel locations in y

  • x (float, array) – pixel locations in x

  • lam (float, array) – weights of each pixel

Returns

  • mu (float) – mean of gaussian fit.

  • cov (float) – covariance of gaussian fit.

  • radii (float, array) – half of major and minor axis lengths of elliptical fit.

  • ellipse (float, array) – coordinates of elliptical fit.

  • area (float) – area of ellipse.

suite2p.utils.enhanced_mean_image(ops)[source]¶

computes enhanced mean image and adds it to ops

Median filters ops[‘meanImg’] with 4*diameter in 2D and subtracts and divides by this median-filtered image to return a high-pass filtered image ops[‘meanImgE’]

Parameters

ops (dictionary) – uses ‘meanImg’, ‘aspect’, ‘diameter’, ‘yrange’ and ‘xrange’

Returns

ops – ‘meanImgE’ field added

Return type

dictionary

suite2p.utils.sub2ind(array_shape, rows, cols)[source]¶
suite2p.utils.get_frames(ops, ix, bin_file, crop=False, badframes=False)[source]¶
get frames ix from bin_file

frames are cropped by ops[‘yrange’] and ops[‘xrange’]

Parameters

  • ops (dict) – requires ‘Ly’, ‘Lx’

  • ix (int, array) – frames to take

  • bin_file (str) – location of binary file to read (frames x Ly x Lx)

  • crop (bool) – whether or not to crop by ‘yrange’ and ‘xrange’ - if True, needed in ops

Returns

mov – frames x Ly x Lx

Return type

int16, array
